channel.title: Delhi HC on Internet Freedom Foundation
channel.description: Recent content in Delhi HC on Internet Freedom Foundation

item.title: Social Science researchers move Delhi High Court to protect LibGen & SciHub
item.description: A group of social science researchers have filed an intervention application, with legal support from IFF, highlighting the adverse impact any decision to block LibGen and SciHub will have on them. A Joint Registrar of the Delhi High Court has issued notice.

item.title: The Delhi High Court directs the CIC to provide a time frame within which our second appeal for information on surveillance orders will be decided
item.description: MHA originally claimed that the RTIs on e-surveillance is exempt for national security, but CIC directed the MHA to re-hear the matter. MHA now claims that it has destroyed the info! We filed another appeal before the CIC, and the Delhi HC directed the CIC to tell the HC a timeline for our appeal.

item.title: Sustained, strategic litigation helps advance transparency in digital policymaking #SaveOurPrivacy
item.description: Updates from the High Court of Delhi on the writ petition of Saurav Das who is challenging the Central Information Commission’s order denying him information on Aarogya Setu.

item.title: CIC observes that IT Ministry's denial on RTI for comments on the Data Protection Bill is, "grossly improper" #SaveOurPrivacy
item.description: In a positive order in our second appeal related to the Data Protection Bill, the CIC directed the CPIO of MeitY to re-visit the RTI application and provide us with a revised reply.

item.title: Delhi HC directs govt to consider representation regarding national Health Data Management Policy #SaveOurPrivacy
item.description: The petition heard by the Delhi HC raised concerns about the unreasonably short deadline for submission of feedback at the height of the COVID-19 pandemic, and highlighted how the existing process excludes persons with disabilities, non-English speakers and people without internet access.
